Trauma
Choking
Seizure

What is the first thing to do in a trauma situation?
Which of the situations does not characterize a situation that can generate a trauma?
What is a trauma?
Touching the victim\'s shoulder without moving her.
Call the person by name, if possible.
Do not move the person.
Hold the victim’s head.
Car accident.
Choking.
Falling of high places.
Crushing.
It is a type of bone fracture.
It is an airborne disease.
It is a cardiovascular disease.
It is an injury caused by a blow or impact.
What is a situation of choking?
Where is the thumb placed to perform the choking rescue maneuver?
What is not right to do in the choking rescue maneuver for babies under 1 year?
It is a foreign body that prevents the air from getting to the lungs.
It is a lung disease.
It is when the brain runs out of oxygen.
It is a type of fall.
In the middle of the personperson\'s chest.
In the person\'s belly button.
Above the person\'s belly button.
Below the person\'s belly button.
Hit the baby\'s back 5 times.
Put the baby up.
Make 5 chest compressions.
Put the baby down.
What is a seizure?
What is the first thing to do with a person having a seizure?
What should not be done with a person having a seizure?
It is when a person faints with the body tense and presents involuntary movement.
It is a contagious disease where you cannot get close to the person.
It is when the person passes out and moves attempting to get up.
It is a disease that causes brain damage and leaves the person bedridden.
Try to stop the movements.
Open the person\'s mouth.
Call the Emergency Medical Service.
Give water or medicine to the person.
Remove everything that is close to the person.
Open the person\'s mouth.
Call the Emergency Medical Service.
Loosen victim’s clothes and wait for the movements to stop.
What is fainting?
What should be done with a person who faints?
What should not be done with a person who faints?
It is when a person falls after stumbling on something.
It is the temporary and sudden loss of consciousness.
It is the loss of balance.
It will always happen in people who are going to have a seizure.
Let the person stand and wait for medical help.
Let the person lying down with her head higher than the body until the rescue arrives.
Leave the person alone and call for help.
Let the person lying down with the head lower than the body until the rescue arrives.
Let the person stand and wait for medical help.
Stand beside the person until the help arrives.
Call for help and provide room for the person to breathe.
Let the person lying down with the head lower than the body until the rescue arrives.
What is a cardiorespiratory arrest?
How do we know that the person is having a respiratory arrest?
What should we do in every cardiorespiratory arrest?
How many compressions should be done in 1 minute?
What is an AED? Who can use it?
What does the AED do?
It is when the person stops breathing and her heart stops beating.
It is only when the person stops breathing.
It is only when the heart stops beating.
It is when the person needs help to breathe.
Feeling the temperature of the body.
Seeing the person desperate to breathe, moving to all sides.
Seeing the chest not moving, by not hearing breathing noises or by not feeling the air coming out when approaching your hand near to the person\'s nose.
Hearing the person calling for help, saying that she cannot breathe.
Leave the person alone and seek for help.
Stand by the person until the help arrives.
Scream desperately for help.
Stay on the person\'s side until someone start compressions.
80-100 compressions.
90-100 compressions.
90-110 compressions.
100-120 compressions.
Automated External Device. Only someone from the Emergency Medical Service.
Automated External Defibrillator. Anyone oriented to use.
Automated External Device. Anyone oriented to use.
Automated External Defibrillator. Only someone from the Emergency Medical Service.
It analyzes the person\'s heartbeats and, when it is appropriate, applies a shock for the heart to beat again.
It analyzes the person\'s heart and makes compression to her chest.
It applies a shock to the person\'s heart so that it beats again.
It analyzes the victim\'s heart.
